usefulItems: parchment paper, cooling rack, toothpick or skewer, loaf pan (approx. 9 in. x 5 in.), cheesecloth, oven
title: Zucchini Bread

ingredients.content: 3 oz unsalted butter, room temperature, plus extra to grease
16 oz zucchini cut into rounds (approx. ½ in.)

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a loaf pan (approx. 9 in. x 5 in.) and line with parchment paper, set aside.
Place zucchini into mixing bowl and grate <b>3-5 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to a cheesecloth (approx. 4-6 layers) and squeeze out as much liquid as possible. Discard liquid and set aside zucchini.
Place sugar and eggs into mixing bowl and mix <b>20 sec/speed 6<b>.
Add yogurt, butter and vanilla and mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>.
Add flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and nutmeg and mix <b>20 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add nuts or raisins (if using) and reserved zucchini and mix <b>5-8 sec/speed 3.5<b>.

Transfer batter to prepared pan and bake 50-60 minutes (350°F) or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean. Allow to rest 10 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack. Allow to cool completely and slice to serve.

hintsAndTricks: Walnuts and raisins are common in zucchini bread, but try pine nuts, Brazil nuts, currants and even some freshly chopped herbs like rosemary and lemon thyme.
If you want to glaze your zucchini loaf, wait until it is completely cooled.
